post.body: I gave my mother in law a home built pc one year. My wife sponge painted it green and yellow. Mother In law was speechless.
@SQLBatman agreed. Unless you're wearing a dress and have big hair you don't need to be drinkin out of a damn boot.
what? No shots to go with it? wussie.
Awesome! I've been married 10 years ... best 10 years of my life.
long story short ... I won't load bad data.
agreed.
Great job! I'm looking forward to contributing to SQLServerPedia.
How are you going to prevent spam or 'bad' edits to wikipages?
I don't know ... I was hoping maybe the hulk hands would make an appearance.
sounds so grown up on the webcast ... what's up with that?
thanks ... I'll check it out this weekend.
I've thought of trying Ubuntu. Is it easy to set up as a dual boot?
'can you code?' ... awesome.
RT: It occurs to me that Chuck E Cheese is basically the Kid Las Vegas without the prostitutes.
yumO
has set up a twitter group for SQLHeroes ... check it out!
good point.
@DenisGobo RT: ANSI-SQL all the way, baby. true dat.
are W's good? Is that like a touchdown or something?
She described me perfectly, except for that part about that bitch Heidi from the hills. total deal breaker.
@crisatunity agreed. the sql devs I've known that liked using cursors had an Oracle background.
it's ok. We haven't had a team worth a shit in 10 years.
Magical ... ummm .... not exactly. At least not around here. btw ... screw you!
the Official DBA of Uptime http://tinyurl.com/5ghl9r
are you sure PresenterMentor is meeting today? I thought it was canceled this month.
congratulations on finishing your book!
and good morning to you!
yes.
Thanks for the tip ... link for book still good (as of 1 min ago).
Took the wife to see Spamalot a couple months ago in Dallas. Fantastic show.
the list of my offenses to gmail is long and colorful, NOT to be shared in mixed company or near small children (or pets).
maybe you should end all posts with DNcfs (DO NOT call fire service) ?
thanks for the weather update. I'm in Euless ... i didn't expect rain. I'd Better get up early to check roads in the am.
I love tearing through a little sql at the end of the day. I love when it all comes together and just works. love it.
Oh crap. My sup just told me he wants the data online today, 'even if it's wrong'. crap, crap, crap. This won't end well.
gotta admit ... I'm starting to really dig the whole SQLServerPedia concept.
getting ready to log into SQLServerPedia wiki webcast - http://tinyurl.com/5z95es
I'm looking for database dev apps that run under linux ... maybe mySQL? I want to play with writing sql in linux.
Are there any linux users out there? I'm looking for suggestions for an easy to try linux distro (maybe puppy?).
wow. http://tinyurl.com/57qowh
Day 3 of woot off .... my resistance is slipping.
http://twitpic.com/sxnr - All new low ...
tried puppy linux tonight ... VERY fast. If I could get online with it I think I would give it a go (at least part time).
Time for breakfast with santa at Lakewood elementary in Euless Texas.
can't sleep so I'm up writing t-sql.
took the kids to High School Musical 3. wow. just wow.
OH review of movie Delgo 'a lot like watching your computer's graphics card vomit.'. 3 guesses which movie the kids pick tonight?
I just joined the sqlheroes Twitter Group http://tgr.me/g/sqlheroes and you can too. Please Retweet.
wow. http://www.jonesbigasstruckrentalandstorage.com/
tried watching Matrix reloaded tonight on cable. so hard to sit through. such a disappointment. so much unfulfilled potential.
about to take the kids to go watch The Tale of Despereaux at movie grill, Euless TX.
having lunch @johnburns72 and @edblankenship and ddw tfs user group.
RT from @hotdogsladies: A "tip" solves your problem in much the same way "fudge" solved your giant ass.
just clicked 'mark all as read' on 372 rss posts in google reader. feeling much better now. goodnight.
feeling a lot of rage today. Imagining punching random people in the face not helping, well ... not helping enough.
Back in gmail.
looks like gmail is down. not good.
